publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3499 Alex Neil: Enterprise Week—That the Parliament celebrates Enterprise Week, taking place from 14 to 20 November 2005, and the opportunity to raise the profile of enterprise and entrepreneurship in Scotland; congratulates the winners of the UK Science Enterprise Centres National Business Plan competition on their success against high-quality applicants from 19 other universities across the United Kingdom; wishes them well as they begin to negotiate investment to grow their companies, starting with competition sponsors, the National Endowment for Science, Technology and the Arts (NESTA), and recognises the role played by the Scottish Institute for Enterprise in developing enterprise and business skills in Scottish higher education institutions.Supported by: Christine Grahame*
S2M-3499 Enterprise Week (lodged on 1 November 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3499 Enterprise Week (lodged on 1 November 2005) Michael Matheson*

S2M-3499 Alex Neil: Enterprise Week—That the Parliament celebrates Enterprise Week, taking place from 14 to 20 November 2005, and the opportunity to raise the profile of enterprise and entrepreneurship in Scotland; congratulates the winners of the UK Science Enterprise Centres National Business Plan competition on their success against high-quality applicants from 19 other universities across the United Kingdom; wishes them well as they begin to negotiate investment to grow their companies, starting with competition sponsors, the National Endowment for Science, Technology and the Arts (NESTA), and recognises the role played by the Scottish Institute for Enterprise in developing enterprise and business skills in Scottish higher education institutions.Supported by: Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Michael Matheson
S2M-3499 Enterprise Week (lodged on 1 November 2005) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3499 Enterprise Week (lodged on 1 November 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3499 Enterprise Week (lodged on 1 November 2005) Mike Pringle*
